page.title: 16RURAL TRANSPORT.
page.content: The village of Merton is poorly served by public transport.There are adequate bus services to Oxford on the weekdays but these don't run in the evenings and there are only limited services at the weekends.A courtesy service to the town of Bicester runs twice a week.Most residents are reliant on cars to get them to work or when they want to go shopping.About 75% of the households in the village use their own cars to get themselves to work.Children are taken to the local schools by coach or car. Traders using vans supply the village with milk,bread,groceries,fish and coal.Doctors' Surgeries are to be found at Islip or at Bicester but getting to them can present problems to the elderly,especially, who haven't got their own transport.The proposed route of the M.40 Motorway will pass very close to the village if it's built.
